snippet: Baba Heru Semahj used to be a New York police officer who walked the beat to study the people. Now he’s a Kemetic priest trying to spread the word about ancient Egypt.
abstract: Corey Kilgannon Character Study column on Baba Heru Semahj, who keeps Egyptian jewelry showroom and shrine for worship and study of ancient spirits of Egypt in Chinatown; Semahj used to be New York City police officer and answer to the name James Georges.
lead_paragraph: Baba Heru Semahj used to be a New York police officer who walked the beat to study the people. Now he’s a Kemetic priest trying to spread the word about ancient Egypt.

headline.print_headline: From Police Beat To Prayer Beads
headline.seo: Baba Heru Semahj, From Police Officer to Kemetic Priest
headline.main: From Police Beat to Prayer Beads
